title: Automated Defect Detection in Atomic Resolution STEM Images: A Machine Learning Approach with Variational Convolutional Autoencoders
content: In recent years, there has been a significant focus on overcoming the challenges associated with locating and measuring defects in materials and understanding their impact on various properties, such as electronic or ionic transport, optical response, or ferroic behavior [1, 2]. Traditional methods, such as transmission electron microscopy (TEM), often rely on the manual identification of atomic columns, especially in areas lacking long-range order, which can be time-consuming and prone to errors. To address this issue, recent studies have explored the use of computer vision (CV) techniques to automate defect detection in atomic-resolution STEM and scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) images [3, 4].
